alert.note: Alert for Clay; De Kalb; Jackson; Overton; Pickett; Putnam; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 11:54PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Overton, northwestern Pickett, central De Kalb, Jackson, southeastern Clay, northwestern White and Putnam Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1153 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gainesboro to 6 miles west of Baxter to 6 miles west of Smithville. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Smithville, Livingston, Celina, Gainesboro, Byrdstown, Algood, Baxter, Hamptons Crossroads, Bakers Crossroads, Whitleyville, Burgess Falls State Park, Rickman, Center Hill Lake, Dale Hollow Lake, Edgar Evans State Park, Cummins Falls State Park and Standing Stone State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 267 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Clay; De Kalb; Jackson; Overton; Pickett; Putnam; White
